result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Lorenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety; except for prescribed medications, taken in prescribed doses.

Any other counseling, treatment, assessments as recommended by the agent.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Count 1 - Bail Jumping - No contest plea.   
Count 3 - Possess THC (2nd + offense) - No contest plea.   
Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 4, & 5.  Motion granted.   Court orders DNA sample.   
Minutes.

2:22 PM Defendant Thomas J. Lorenz appeared by video.  Attorney Marcus Lasalle Falk appeared by video for Thomas J. Lorenz.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment held. Defendant waives the reading of the Information. Not guilty plea entered to the charges contained in the Information. Defendant waives right to substitution.  States offer to be given to defense/defendant by
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:50 PM Defendant Thomas J. Lorenz appeared by video initially.  Attorney Marcus Lasalle Falk appeared by video for Thomas J. Lorenz.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Parties sent to a ZOOM breakout room.  Defendant fails to return back.  Attorney Falk informs the Court that it is Mr. Lorenz's intent to waive the preliminary examination.  State is okay with rescheduling the matter since defendant did appear initially and intends to waive his preliminary examination.  Court tolls time limits.  State will not be subpoenaing its witnesses for the hearing given the waiver.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:38 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas J. Lorenz appeared by video.  Attorney Marcus Lasalle Falk appeared by video for Thomas J. Lorenz. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. felony bail jumping, possess THC, possess fentanyl, and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
